page.title: 12HORSE RIDING
page.content: I go to Elm Trees Riding stables in Skelmanthorpe. I go every Saturday at 9.00am till 3.00pm. I help to groom, tack up,muck out and lead the horses. I stay all day.The stables have about 16 horses. Before our dinner we have to make the feeds and give the horses water. The feed consists of sugarbeet and bran. At 12.30 I have my dinner with about four other girls. At 2.00 I have a ride. I sometimes go out on a hack. I sometimes do cantering and jumping in the all weather track. An all weather track is made of a ditch filled with stones. Over the stones is a layer of soil and a big piece of plastic covering is placed over the soil. Hard wood chippings are used on top of the plastic covering to create soft ground for the horses.
